page.title: 01TEIGNBRIDGE
page.content: Thousands of summer visitors are familiar with the holiday delights of Torquay and probably the legendary traffic chaos of Newton Abbot but tucked away a mere three miles from both these well known towns are the twin villages of Stokeinteignhead and Combeinteignhead together with the smaller hamlets of Netherton and Haccombe. Occasional visitors do brave the narrow lanes to savour the atmosphere of the Church House Inn, Stoke; the Wild Goose, Combe; or even the Combe Cellars, prominent on the south bank of the River Teign and clearly seen by passengers travelling on the railway which runs along the northern bank. From the school playground at Stokeinteignhead one can clearly hear the HST's racing along the Teign valley.
